answers.answer: It happened to me two years ago. The doctor was about to send me home as my contractions weren't strong enough, but once they did an u/s they saw my fluid was low. They couldn't let me go home or walk around the hospital. I was induced at about 1:45 p.m. and had my son at 1:33 a.m. I was 40 weeks & 2 days.
Oh you were 40 weeks. I'm 34w5d but measuring at 37w  she already weighs 6pounds almost 7

i dont know about the fluikd but goin thro same thingwith preeclampsia, im 35+1 and theres a possibilty i cud go in as early as tomorrow if bp hasnt improved, i hope they can keep u goin as longas possible
I know I'm scared! Are you scared?

yup terrified, not knowing , im hoping to at least get to 37 im guessing if my blood pressure improves they may leave me till then, when ur supposed to have 5 weeks left u dnt expect to be told u could have him with in a week...lucky enough were prepared just in case...babies born between 35-36 weeks normally do ok without any extra help or so ive read
Being induced is the best. And way less need to be worried
Iv Hurd that to! Goodluck I know everything will be fine:)

question: I went to my dr yday and they said my fluids low but not dangerously low and I have to see him in a week he said if my fluid gets lower ima have to have the baby that day! I asked him should I be worried he said no everything's fine with the baby. Has anything like this happen to any of you lady's? And if so what happen?
title: Low fluid
